title: Not just China, Trump 2.0 could spell trouble for U.S. allies as he doubles down on tariff talk
content: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.
summary: Trump's latest presidential campaign has increasingly framed American allies in Europe and Asia as trade rivals and targets for tariffs alongside China.

title: UniCredit's pursuit of Commerzbank reflects a watershed moment for Europe — and its banking union
content: European banking's latest takeover battle is widely regarded as a potential turning point for the region — particularly the bloc's incomplete banking union.
summary: European banking's latest takeover battle is widely regarded as a potential turning point for the region — particularly the bloc's incomplete banking union.

title: UK finance chiefs are banging the drum for one major reform to boost economic growth
content: U.K. finance chiefs are banging the drum for pension reforms to boost anaemic investment and growth in the country.
summary: U.K. finance chiefs are banging the drum for pension reforms to boost anaemic investment and growth in the country.

title: Bank of Japan board members split over monetary policy path, meeting minutes show
content: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.
summary: The BOJ raised its benchmark policy rate to "around 0.25%" in a 7-2 split decision in July, marking its highest interest rate since 2008.

title: Japan's Nikkei leads gains in Asia-Pacific markets; China's CSI 300 extends rally to seventh day
content: Mainland China's CSI 300 extended a six-day winning streak, hitting its highest levels in almost two months.
summary: Mainland China's CSI 300 extended a six-day winning streak, hitting its highest levels in almost two months.

title: India wants to become a semiconductor powerhouse, but it can't do it on its own
content: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.
summary: India has big ambitions to become a semiconductor powerhouse as the world's fifth-largest economy pushes for self-reliance in manufacturing.

title: SK Hynix announces mass production of updated AI chip, spurring rally in Asian semiconductor stocks

title: Australia's inflation rate has come within its target range, but rate cuts likely won't come anytime soon
content: The RBA had expected inflation to fall. RBA Gov. Michelle Bullock said that inflation is expected to climb above the target range again when government reliefs expire.
summary: The RBA had expected inflation to fall. RBA Gov. Michelle Bullock said that inflation is expected to climb above the target range again when government reliefs expire.

title: Japan's largest rice shortage in years is exacerbated by sushi-hungry tourists, weather
content: Japanese rice is a key staple in many of its iconic dishes, but the country is facing its biggest shortfall in years.
summary: Japanese rice is a key staple in many of its iconic dishes, but the country is facing its biggest shortfall in years.

title: These are the top 10 emerging startups in India in 2024, according to LinkedIn

title: Cathay Pacific bans couple after video showed inflight dispute over reclined seat
content: A video of the incident shows a couple taunting, using vulgar gestures and jostling the chair of a female passenger who reclined her seat on a long-haul flight.
summary: A video of the incident shows a couple taunting, using vulgar gestures and jostling the chair of a female passenger who reclined her seat on a long-haul flight.

title: China offers one-time cash allowance for those in extreme poverty
content: China announced it will offer a one-time cash allowance to those in extreme poverty, after it rolled out a slate of stimulus aimed at shoring up the economy.

title: Trump says Zelenskyy insulted him; House GOP to probe Ukraine leader's PA trip

title: Fearful of the 'middle-income trap,' Indonesia pushes for major policy reform
content: The nation's finance minister said its yearly 5% GDP growth of is "not enough" for Indonesia to achieve the progress needed to become a high-income country.
summary: The nation's finance minister said its yearly 5% GDP growth of is "not enough" for Indonesia to achieve the progress needed to become a high-income country.

title: OpenAI considering restructuring to for-profit, CTO Mira Murati and two top research execs depart
content: OpenAI's board is considering plans to restructure the firm to a for-profit business. CTO Mira Murati and two top research execs said they are leaving.
summary: OpenAI's board is considering plans to restructure the firm to a for-profit business. CTO Mira Murati and two top research execs said they are leaving.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Time to look at AI-adjacent plays
content: The AI wave will ripple throughout the ocean for some time. Big Tech or semiconductors are juicy catches, but a wider net might reel in other prizes.

title: Surging AI demand could cause the world's next chip shortage, research says
content: A surge in demand for AI semiconductors and AI-enabled smartphones and laptops could lead to the next global chip shortage, according to Bain & Company.
summary: A surge in demand for AI semiconductors and AI-enabled smartphones and laptops could lead to the next global chip shortage, according to Bain & Company.

title: China likely needs more than rate cuts to boost economic growth

title: Google files EU antitrust complaint accusing Microsoft of stifling cloud competition

title: 'Stop ripping us off': Senate grills Novo Nordisk CEO on weight loss drug pricing

title: Meet the ex-Goldman wealth advisor who quit to solve Britain’s £567 billion gender investment gap
